author: admin_l6ma5gus
title: Russia Ukraine War, Zelensky Visits Area From Which Attack Launched In Kursk. Kiev Sinks Russian Cargo
text:
The Ukrainian President, Volodymyr Zelensky visited the border area with Russia for the first time since Kiev forces entered from there and launched the offensive in Russian Kursk .
But tensions in Russia are very high in relation to Kursk and not only: in another example of the intensification of Ukrainian attacks, Emergency authorities in Russia’s Krasnodar region said a Ukrainian attack hit a ferry loaded with fuel tanks in the port of Kavkaz near Crimea, triggering a fire, and according to Russian agencies the ferry sank.
Russian President Vladimir Putin has accused Kiev of attempting to strike the Kursk nuclear power plant, adding that the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) has been informed. IAEA chief Rafael Grossi is expected to visit the plant next week, RIA Novosti reported.
Furthermore, After the case of Rai journalists Stefania Battistini and Simone Traini, Russia has opened criminal proceedings against 3 other foreign journalists for illegally crossing the state border in the Kursk region: CNN journalist Nick Peyton Walsh and Ukrainian correspondents Borovik Olesya Nikolaevna and Butsko Diana Vladimirovna.
Meanwhile, while the US has warned Kiev that Russia could prepare attacks ahead of Ukrainian Independence Day, which falls on August 24, Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi is expected by Zelensky in the Ukrainian capital .
For further information:
#Russia #Ukraine #War #Zelensky #Visits #Area #Attack #Launched #Kursk #Kiev #Sinks #Russian #Cargo

author: E! News
title: 10 Cooling Bedding Must-Haves
text:
The products featured in this article are from brands available in NBCUniversal Checkout. E! makes a commission on purchases.
Temperature regulation could be one of the reasons you're having trouble falling asleep, staying asleep, and getting the rest you need.
No, it's not just your mattress. If you always seem to wake up with your duvet and blanket kicked off the bed, you're not imagining things. Your body heat, whether from your regular body temperature or even elevated cortisol, could be sabotaging your sleep quality.
If you're a hot sleeper, you may also suffer from night sweats. And even though it seems helpful, your mattress protector could be trapping heat, making your sleep situation worse.
The good news? You can sleep cooler—and better—starting tonight. It’s time to upgrade your setup with the best cooling sheets, pillows and pillowcases, blankets, quilts, and more.
You don’t have to settle for shivering under just a flat sheet. There’s a sweet spot with comforting pressure without the extra heat, and body temperature-regulating bedding is the key.
And guess what? Our shopping experts found the best of the best for you.
If you're a hot sleeper, we’ve got exactly what you need to cool down your body and your bed.
Ahead, shop must-have cooling pillows, comforters, and linen sheets from Slumber Cloud, plus breathable cotton and linen sheet sets from Avec, Bare Home, Pattern Brands, and more.
Hot sleepers, it's time to chill out. Scroll on to find your new favorite cool-down essentials.
Slumber Cloud Ultracool Comforter
Stop kicking off your comforter! This cooling nylon and spandex Slumber Cloud bedding essential is made with NASA-engineered fiberfill for year-round comfort.
It comes in two-weights: lightweight for the hottest sleepers and all-season for those who prefer a little more weight and want a little more warmth.
Choose from three colors. Runs from Twin/TwinXL to King/California King.
Bare Home Percale Fitted Sheet
If you're a hot sleeper, you may leave off the top sheet. That means you need a fitted sheet that feels amazing. This certified-organic percale fitted sheet is lightweight and provides a cool, crisp, and breathable sleeping experience.
This deep-pocket fitted sheet is fully elasticized to provide a secure fit on any size mattress up to 15 inches deep. Machine washable for easy care.
Choose from seven colors and eight mattress sizes.
Slumber Cloud Performance Linen Blend Sheet Set
Linen sheets allow air to pass through them more freely, helping you regulate your body temperature all night and stay cool. This sheet set combines temperature-regulating Outlast viscose fibers with the timeless appeal of linen.
Designed to get softer with every wash, it offers both luxury and lasting comfort, making it the perfect blend of performance and elegance.
Choose from two colors. Runs from a size Twin to a California King.
Avec Classic Linen Viscose Top Sheet
Maybe you're a hot sleeper but you need the pressure of a top sheet.
This linen viscose option will do the trick of keeping you covered up and nice and cool. It's designed to get softer after every wash, too.
Choose from four colors. Runs from size Twin to King.
Slumber Cloud Adjustable Ultracool Pillow
This cooling pillow can be tailored to your sleeping habits.
It offers customizable firmness with two inserts and zippered gussets, blending squishy fiberfill with supportive memory foam for cool comfort all night.
Per the brand, back sleepers: Use both inserts and keep the gussets zipped closed. Side sleepers: Use both inserts and unzip the gussets. Stomach sleepers: Remove 1 insert of your choice and unzip the gussets.
Choose from two sizes.
Slumber Cloud Ultracool Pillow
This must-have pillow is designed to help manage heat through your pillowcase.
It features premium NASA-engineered Outlast fabric on both sides to help fight off heat. Two firmness levels allow for perfect neck support. Choose from two sizes.
Pillows start at $79 for a standard, single pillow.
Avec Pillowcase Set
This set of 300 thread count pillowcases is made from 90% viscose from bamboo and 10% European Flax linen to keep your head nice and cool. Even better? They're machine washable.
Choose from four colors and two sizes.
Prices start at $39.
Comfy Cooling Blanket
This cooling blanket is designed to absorb body heat. It's made with Japanese q-max 0.4 cooling fiber, and features a 100% cotton backing.
This machine-washable blanket can fit a double-size sofa.
Pattern Brands French Linen Sheet Set
French flax fabric is a great option for hot sleepers. The looser weave allows air to circulate more freely, keeping you from getting too warm while you rest.
The set includes a fitted French linen sheet, two French linen pillowcases, and an optional linen flat sheet.
Choose from three colors.
Avec Cotton Quilt
If you're looking for an airy quilt that won't weigh you down in your sleep, you've found it!
This Avec cotton quilt features down alternative fiberfill. Choose from two weights for your perfect temp. Hot sleepers should opt for lightweight, while those looking for more warmth can choose all-season.
Choose from three colors and three sizes. Prices start at $159.

author: Karolin Aertel
title: Digitalisierung stockt: Magdeburgs Schulen kämpfen mit digitaler Ausstattung: Technikprobleme bremsen den Unterricht
text:
Digitalisierung stockt Magdeburgs Schulen kämpfen mit digitaler Ausstattung: Technikprobleme bremsen den Unterricht
Drucker, die nicht drucken. Smartboards ohne Bild. Software, die streikt. Trotz Digitalpakt hapert es an der digitalen Ausstattung vieler Schulen in Magdeburg.
26.06.2025, 07:00
Magdeburg. - Die Digitalisierung an Magdeburgs Schulen läuft alles andere als reibungslos. Bei der Installation notwendiger Software kommt es immer wieder zu Problemen. Mit Folgen für den Unterricht.

author: Bryan Gottlieb
title: LA Effluent Outfall Tunnel Collapse Traps 31 Workers, All Rescued Uninjured | Engineering News-Record
text:
Water Projects
LA Wastewater Tunnel Collapse Traps 31 Workers, All Rescued Uninjured
“Squeezing ground” may have caused an 18‑ft TBM segment to give way; rigorous refuge‑chamber spacing and on‑call LAFD drills kept all 31 workers safe
An 18‑ft‑diameter section of the Los Angeles Effluent Outfall Tunnel partially collapsed late Wednesday, briefly trapping 31 construction workers roughly six miles from the only shaft access.
Crews from the Los Angeles Fire Department’s Urban Search and Rescue units and paramedics entered the tunnel and found that colleagues of the trapped men had already climbed over a 12-ft to 15-ft pile of soil and debris to reach and evacuate them via a tunnel transport vehicle.
According to a statement by the Los Angeles County Sanitation Districts, the incident occurred around 7:45 p.m.; by 9:20 p.m., all 31 workers were back on the surface, uninjured and had been released after a medical evaluation.
“What started out as a very frightening evening… I just have to tell you that we’re all blessed today in Los Angeles. No one was injured. Everyone is safe,” L.A. Mayor Karen Bass said at an early-morning press conference.
The incident occurred within the joint Clearwater Program’s Los Angeles Effluent Outfall Tunnel, a $630.5-million, seven‑mile‑long conduit designed to carry treated wastewater from the Hyperion Water Reclamation Plant to ocean outfalls near San Pedro, about 7.5 miles north of Long Beach. The tunnel lining consists of bolted and gasketed precast concrete segments which are installed after the TBM has passed.
Interim Fire Chief Ronnie Villanueva added that more than 100 firefighters, drones, search canines and hazardous materials specialists were staged for what was quickly escalated to a major emergency tunnel rescue at 7:58 p.m.
The Clearwater Project replaces existing wastewater tunnels built in the 1930s and 1950s.
Map courtesy Los Angeles County Sanitation Districts
In a statement, the sanitation district said the collapse posed no environmental risk as the tunnel was not in service.
Cal/OSHA and the Los Angeles County Sanitation District have launched joint investigations into the collapse, which engineers say may have been precipitated by “squeezing ground” conditions—when soft or fractured soils exert inward pressure on the TBM shield.
The Sanitations Dept. said Clearwater Tunnel operations have been halted while this investigation takes place and there is no timeframe for how long the process will take.
Construction Operations
The LAFD said the trapped men were operating at the tunnel face—monitoring tunnel boring machine controls, removing excavated soil, and guiding new ring segments into place—when the collapse occurred. Four additional crew members had backup roles just behind them, assisting in muck removal and equipment handling.
FlatironDragados serves as the prime contractor, employing a TBM nicknamed "Rachel," to bore 18-ft internal-diameter sections 450 ft below existing roadways.
According to the LAFD, the failure occurred in the soft‑soil portion of the alignment beneath the city of Wilmington. The harbor‑area alluvium there is more susceptible to “squeezing ground” conditions when punctured by a TBM.
As the TBM advances, it installs a precast, segmental concrete liner in 5-ft rings immediately behind the cutterhead. This “construct as you go” approach provides continuous support to the freshly excavated ground and limits deformation, according to the agency.
According the sanitation district, the TBM is expected to finish boring the tunnel this year and construction will be completed in 2027. The new line is scheduled to be operational in 2028. The tunnel will replace aging pipelines installed in 1937 and 1958, cross-fault seismic risks, and overflow during major storms.
Parsons Corp. and McMillen Jacobs Associates led the geotechnical and design phases, using deep-bore and soil analysis to map ground conditions.
FlatironDragados’s safety plan includes recurring inspections of the segmental liner, emergency refuge areas every 1,500 ft and on‑call rescue drills in coordination with LAFD.
Construction work engines operate exclusively underground, with daily pre-shift safety briefings and continuous atmospheric monitoring in trapped-entry zones. Continuous atmospheric monitoring and on-call rescue drills with LAFD are integrated into the construction schedule, which limits all surface disruptions to weekdays and restores sites to pre-construction conditions upon completion.
